name: A Curatorial Perspective: Chay Reds, Ferrous Black
description:
Join us for a guided walk of our latest exhibition, “Chay Reds, Ferrous Black” with curator Yash Sanhotra. This exhibition reveals the untold stories of Indian textiles found in Sri Lanka. Featuring exquisite Palampores and textile fragments, dating back to the 18th century, they once graced humble homes as well as sacred temples. Today, they serve as storytellers, weaving together the rich and intricate history shared between two ancient cultures.

Whether you are fascinated by history, drawn to myths and legends, or a lover of textile craftsmanship, “Chay Reds, Ferrous Black” offers an evocative look into the ties that have bound India and Sri Lanka together for generations. Be a part of this interactive session and learn more about textiles and the tales they tell.

name: The Sarjapur Blues Band
description:
Join us for an evening that blends music, art, and craft with The Sarjapur Blues Band (SBB), featuring underground musicians Shekhar Seshadri (vocals and acoustic guitar) and Vinoo Matthew (electric guitar).

The self-professed “workingman’s, back-street” duo will introduce us to lutherie - the art and craft of making wooden stringed instruments by hand. Discover the stories behind the SBB's unique, handcrafted instruments as they perform their signature eclectic, and original rhythm and blues.

Expanding that conversation from the aural to the visual, we also invite you to explore our ongoing exhibition, Painting with Fire, where we look at how wood becomes a canvas upon which two artists leave their mark. 

This engagement is conceptualised under our exhibition Painting with Fire: Jeram Patel & Tarik Currimbhoy

name: Block Printing Workshop (3:00 PM)
description: Join us for a hands-on block printing workshop with Pooja Gokul from Amoha Prints. Learn the ancient art of block printing, from its rich history and techniques to designing your own patterns and creating your own block-printed masterpiece. Whether you’re an artist or a beginner, this workshop offers an opportunity to explore your creativity and take home your own personalised print!

name: Notes from the Conservation Lab
description:
What goes on behind the scenes of an exhibition? Come find out in this guided tour of our latest exhibition, Chay Reds, Ferrous Black, where we focus on the meticulous process of textile conservation. Our conservators will share their expert insights into the techniques used to preserve and present these delicate artefacts. You’ll also have the opportunity to witness live demonstrations and ask questions about the challenges and processes of textile conservation.

 

This exhibition reveals the untold stories of Indian textiles found in Sri Lanka. Featuring exquisite Palampores and textile fragments, dating back to the 18th century. These once graced homes as well as sacred temples. Today, they serve as tools for storytelling, weaving together the rich and intricate history shared between two ancient cultures.

Note: There are only a few spots available for this event, so please book your spot as soon as possible.
